Description: Tergeo Technologies is a developer of robotic solutions to sanitation challenges.
Headquarters Regions: Greater Philadelphia Area, Great Lakes, Northeastern US
Full Description: At Tergeo Technologies we're creating robots that will completely automate and robotize sidewalk cleaning by having one worker overseeing several robots cleaning simultaneously. Litter is an enormous problem. The presence of litter in a neighborhood suppresses property values, decreases foot traffic and commercial activity, and negatively impacts mental health; all this in addition to just being an all around environmental pollutant and eyesore.   We're achieving this by designing a modular system. The robot provides the physical sensors and actuators, we implement an autonomy software module to govern its behavior corresponding with its use-case, and we attach a tool for a specific mission. For our short-term plan, we are developing a robot that can navigate safely along a commercial corridor sidewalk while pulling a power sweeper. While our first target is combating litter, this modular approach with a focus on outdoor navigation allows for this robot to be used in numerous other cases. Swap out the power sweeper for a lawn mower or seeder and you can do largescale lawncare. Add in a painting attachment and you can paint lines on a set of athletic fields and take care of all their landscaping needs. Put a snowplow on the front and a salt spreader on back and it can take care of sidewalk snow removal and ice treatment, among other possibilities.

Currently, the PCB industry predominantly employs a ""subtractive"" manufacturing method, which is highly labor and process intensive, produces poor yields at finer geometries and is limited in shape (flat only) and number of compatible substrates. The subtractive method is very caustic to the environment and the waste by product is expensive to mitigate. Furthermore, an antiquated process makes for a heavily commoditized market with extremely low margins.    Enter eSurface, a fully additive process. Manufacturing is simpler and more efficient, with far fewer processing steps. Yields are higher, even in multiples, for much finer and far more complex PCB designs. Labor usage and space requirements are reduced by multiples. Finally, as a result of these improvements, production costs are projected to descend by 50% or more.    Additionally, eSurface enables enhanced signal integrity, due to far tighter tolerances, expanded material selections, allowing plating of circuits on practically any material and shape, including 3D surfaces.    Also, there is vast improvement in adhesion of metal to substrate and, lastly, important environmental benefits via a closed loop process, radically reducing toxic waste. All of these improvements make for significant advances in microelectronics.    The eSurface business model is to license its technology to manufacturers for a royalty fee.
